responses: Working at heights requires proper fall protection equipment like harnesses, safety nets, and guardrails. Always inspect equipment before use.
For height work, use proper PPE including a full-body harness, hard hat, and non-slip footwear. Ensure anchor points are secure.
When working at heights, maintain 3-point contact on ladders and never exceed the weight limit. Scaffolding must be erected by qualified personnel.

patterns: how to check fall protection equipment
responses: Inspect harnesses for: 1) Frayed or cut webbing 2) Broken stitching 3) Corroded buckles 4) Damaged D-rings. Replace if any defects are found.
Before each use, check your harness for wear and tear. Pay special attention to attachment points and load-bearing components.
intents.follow_up: Would you like the complete harness inspection checklist?

responses: Ladder safety tips: 1) Maintain 3-point contact 2) Angle extension ladders 1:4 ratio 3) Don't stand on top two rungs 4) Secure ladder at top and bottom
Always inspect ladders before use. Check for loose rungs, cracks, and clean footwear before climbing to prevent slips.
